HiddenGnome.synopsis: Philomeen is ready to die for her cause. She has run from the duergar with explosives and when the player arrives, she assumes they are a true soul and would sooner blow herself up than let the player take her to Moonrise.If you reach the end of her dialogue, she'll leave once you get far enough away.
HiddenGnome.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. use debug book - Go to region > Act 1 > UND > Panic Room4. Teleport through the Intricate Door (CTRL-Shift-T)5. Move towards Philomene.

PAD.synopsis: Players find the journal in the Panic Room after identifying the Merregon Masks. This belonged to a Dark Justiciar who hid from the orthon when it rampaged, and was trapped when rubble fell.

HiddenGnome_2.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_2.text: Tell Laridda I'm dead. It's the best way.

HiddenGnome_209.context: CinematicNodeContext: Deep gnome conjures a fire in her hand.

HiddenGnome_45.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_45.text: Hold it. I swear to Ironhand, one more step and I blow us to chunks!
HiddenGnome_45.context: NodeContext: Ready to blow you and her up.

HiddenGnome_176.speaker: Narrator
HiddenGnome_176.text: *An ashen scent fills the air. The barrel is filled with smokepowder.*

HiddenGnome_126.speaker: Narrator
HiddenGnome_126.text: *But the scent is acrid, as if contaminated somehow. Or much, much more concentrated.*

HiddenGnome_55.speaker: Lae'zel
HiddenGnome_55.text: Chk - the gnome's well and truly mad.

HiddenGnome_132.speaker: Shadowheart
HiddenGnome_132.text: Careful. I'd rather not have to pick bits of gnome from my hair.

HiddenGnome_52.speaker: Karlach
HiddenGnome_52.text: She's gonna blow up. That's my thing.

HiddenGnome_81.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_81.text: Shut your mouth, hoon, or I'll shut you down.
HiddenGnome_81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to player companion.NodeContext: Hoon = outsider, an expletive of sorts. Pronounced like it is spelled.

HiddenGnome_56.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_56.text: Philomeen, I presume. What's going on here?

HiddenGnome_46.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_46.text: Drugh. Dropping my name like your cultist arse knows me. Like we're friends.

HiddenGnome_21.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_21.text: Hold on. There's something different about that powder.

HiddenGnome_86.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_86.text: Calm down. Let's talk this through.

HiddenGnome_4.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_4.text: What's to say? You're Nere's bootlicker - saw you sail in. A godsdamned True Soul.

HiddenGnome_104.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_104.text: Better to die in this shit-heap than rot in Moonrise. You want me? Come get me.

HiddenGnome_37.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_37.text: You will not serve Ironhand in death. But you might still serve him in life.

HiddenGnome_171.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_171.text: What the drugh? You - you know nothing of me, damn it.
HiddenGnome_171.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

HiddenGnome_158.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_158.text: Laridda sent me. The gnomes need your help.

HiddenGnome_114.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_114.text: Laridda? Ruddy mind games. I... I know all about your tricks, True Soul.
HiddenGnome_114.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She has JUST enough fondness for Laridda to be convinced.

HiddenGnome_131.context: CinematicNodeContext: Philomeen sighs and lowers her hand. The flame goes out.

HiddenGnome_182.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_182.text: Bugger it all - you moved them.

HiddenGnome_155.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_155.text: Go on, drag me to Moonrise. I'll make you cult-nutters suffer.

HiddenGnome_140.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_140.text: I don't want you. I will take that smokepowder, though.

HiddenGnome_74.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_74.text: What good is a single vial?

HiddenGnome_172.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_172.text: Very generous of you - I accept.

HiddenGnome_0.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_0.text: It sounds valuable. On second thought, I'll take it all.

HiddenGnome_149.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_149.text: Calm down. Beldron's trapped in a cave-in, and I need the smokepowder.

HiddenGnome_62.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_62.text: I don't want you. I just wanted the smokepowder.

HiddenGnome_13.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_13.text: Runepowder, you mean. Such a damned waste...

HiddenGnome_134.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_134.text: Calm down. Beldron's trapped in a cave-in, and I needed the smokepowder.

HiddenGnome_190.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_190.text: I'm not taking you anywhere. You're free to go.

HiddenGnome_91.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_91.text: I'm not stupid, you know. No such thing in Grymforge as kind hearts.

HiddenGnome_24.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_24.text: Spit out what you want and let's be done with it.

HiddenGnome_32.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_32.text: What I want is your help. Beldron's trapped - I need the smokepowder.

HiddenGnome_39.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_39.text: You want to waste runepowder on -
HiddenGnome_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Aghast, catches herself.NodeContext: Aghast, catches herself.

HiddenGnome_60.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_60.text: How about a little of that smokepowder?

HiddenGnome_33.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_33.text: You want to barter with runepowder -
HiddenGnome_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Aghast, catches herself.NodeContext: Aghast, catches herself.

HiddenGnome_161.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_161.text: Look. You have no idea what you're dealing with. Any true Ironhand would trade their life for a grain of this stuff.
HiddenGnome_161.context: NodeContext: Steadying her voice and continuing - she was reacting with horror to our ignorance

HiddenGnome_94.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_94.text: It's the whole damn reason we're here, and I'm not leaving without it.

HiddenGnome_58.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_58.text: But let me go... and maybe I'll spare you a vial.

HiddenGnome_196.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_196.text: 'Ironhand'. 'Runepowder'. Where have you heard these terms before?

HiddenGnome_98.speaker: Narrator
HiddenGnome_98.text: *Runepowder is gnomish folklore - an explosive of awesome power, handed down to the gnomes by their war-god Gaerdal Ironhand.*

HiddenGnome_70.speaker: Narrator
HiddenGnome_70.text: *A formula so dangerous it was stricken from history - if it ever existed to begin with.*

HiddenGnome_1.speaker: Narrator
HiddenGnome_1.text: *Vague notions of rumour and myth - nothing solid comes to mind.*

HiddenGnome_5.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_5.text: I'll need to know a little more about your so-called 'mission' before I let you go.

HiddenGnome_84.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_84.text: Look. We're freedom fighters. We need this powder to a prove a point. To people who really need a point proven to them.

HiddenGnome_36.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_36.text: Let me go, and you'll be on the right side of history - that's all I can say.

HiddenGnome_40.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_40.text: 'Runepowder'? I thought that was a children's story.

HiddenGnome_200.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_200.text: We've heard the same ones, I bet. A fistful of fire that can turn cities to dust.

HiddenGnome_178.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_178.text: Well it's real, and I need to bring it back to Baldur's Gate. I'd rather my clan were with me, but...

HiddenGnome_9.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_9.text: The mission comes first. A vial's what I can spare you.

HiddenGnome_156.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_156.text: 'Runepowder'? I thought that was a burrow-tale.

HiddenGnome_59.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_59.text: What use is a single vial?

HiddenGnome_203.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_203.text: A barrel of this could light up the Underdark. A vial is plenty - just let me go my way.

HiddenGnome_3.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_3.text: Don't be stupid. We're parting ways here. Up to you in how many pieces.

HiddenGnome_163.context: CinematicNodeContext: She tosses the player a vial (throw and catch with hands off-screen, preferably)

HiddenGnome_67.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_67.context: NodeContext: Our business is concluded, but she's mulling over whether to ask us a favour. She's not one to agonise so her own reluctance annoyes her (this leads into 'You see Laridda at the dig?'

HiddenGnome_153.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_153.text: You see Laridda at the dig? Tell her I'm dead. Impaled, half-eaten... I don't care - make up a story.

HiddenGnome_80.speaker: Shadowheart
HiddenGnome_80.text: I'm not sure I blame her. Though Laridda might.

HiddenGnome_16.speaker: Karlach
HiddenGnome_16.text: And I thought I'd heard it all. That's some cambion-level deception.

HiddenGnome_53.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_53.text: You'd abandon your beloved? That's mighty cruel of you.

HiddenGnome_122.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_122.text: Beloved? I might have been hers. She sure as hells wasn't mine.

HiddenGnome_29.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_29.text: I'm getting the runepowder back to Baldur's Gate. Alone.
HiddenGnome_29.context: NodeContext: 'The' ponounced with a long E. THE END.

HiddenGnome_123.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_123.text: I'm getting gone. You ought to do the same.
HiddenGnome_123.context: NodeContext: 'The' ponounced with a long E. THE END.

HiddenGnome_19.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_19.text: I go where there's shit to stir. And there's no shortage of options.

HiddenGnome_113.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_113.text: Your friends are dead. And you will be too if you don't flee this place.

HiddenGnome_41.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_41.text: Dead? Of course. They should have run, had every chance.

HiddenGnome_150.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_150.text: Your friends are freed and gathering across the lake. You should join them.

HiddenGnome_142.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_142.text: Friends? Cowards, more like. Gave them a good blast as cover, and they sat on their bony arses. Done for good with them.
HiddenGnome_142.context: NodeContext: Calling out to her lover who is not actually there.

HiddenGnome_194.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_194.text: I'll pass on the word - right after I kill you.

HiddenGnome_30.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_30.text: I knew I couldn't trust you. Do it, then. Make it hurt.

HiddenGnome_170.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_170.text: Laridda needs you. So does your crew - your burrow.

HiddenGnome_47.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_47.text: Words. I'm about more than that.

HiddenGnome_197.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_197.text: I could tell her I ate you. Think she'd believe me?

HiddenGnome_31.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_31.text: So you'll just leave your clan behind?

HiddenGnome_99.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_99.text: Don't talk of my clan like you understand.

HiddenGnome_102.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_102.text: Just make it work, all right?

HiddenGnome_129.speaker: Astarion
HiddenGnome_129.text: Ah, nothing says 'true love' like faking your own death to avoid someone.

HiddenGnome_68.speaker: Wyll
HiddenGnome_68.text: She's leaving? Laridda will be heartbroken.

HiddenGnome_92.speaker: Gale
HiddenGnome_92.text: She has a heart made of stone, this one - that only smokepowder can break.

HiddenGnome_105.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_105.text: ... it's gone? You damned rat. I knew I couldn't trust you!

HiddenGnome_103.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_103.text: I want nothing from you, I swear.

HiddenGnome_17.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_17.text: Your head. It will make a nice souvenir.

HiddenGnome_108.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_108.text: 'Course I am. You got the runepowder. So now you cut and run.

HiddenGnome_191.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_191.text: It's the whole damn reason we're here.

HiddenGnome_15.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_15.text: The powder's 'the reason you're here'? How so?

HiddenGnome_138.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_138.text: 'Runepowder'? I thought that was a burrow-tale.

HiddenGnome_120.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_120.text: Well, it's real, and I need to bring it back to Baldur's Gate.

HiddenGnome_118.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_118.text: A vial's all I got left. And I'm not parting with it for nothing.

HiddenGnome_87.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_87.text: A vial's all I got... wait...

HiddenGnome_168.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_168.text: 'Runepowder'? I thought that was a children's story.

HiddenGnome_160.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_160.text: Fine - I've heard all I need.

HiddenGnome_179.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_179.text: I'd rather have the pleasure of killing you with my own hands.

HiddenGnome_57.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_57.text: Laridda? Drugning mind games. I know all about your tricks, True Soul.

HiddenGnome_164.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_164.text: Gaerdal Ironhand, hear me now - set me free!
HiddenGnome_164.context: NodeContext: About to blow herself up, thinking she is dying an honorable death.

HiddenGnome_143.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laridda prepares to fling her spell. Transition to gameplay: Laridda fires the spell and blows herself up.

HiddenGnome_165.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_165.text: If I was a True Soul, you'd be dead. Stand down before you hurt yourself.

HiddenGnome_65.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_65.text: Not a True Soul? And I'm - I'm supposed to believe that?
HiddenGnome_65.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

HiddenGnome_187.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_187.text: Drugnin' liars. Wouldn't know truth if it slapped you broadside.

HiddenGnome_188.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_188.text: KILL THE FIRE. OR DIE. PAINFULLY.

HiddenGnome_27.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_27.text: Smile sincerely and hold out your hand.

HiddenGnome_119.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_119.text: Don't do this. Don't pretend you - you give a shit about me.
HiddenGnome_119.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

HiddenGnome_117.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_117.text: Oh, for... I'm gonna blow, and you're getting chummy? Drugh off, prickslit.

HiddenGnome_11.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_11.text: Are you sure about this? Once you're dead, that's it. It's over.

HiddenGnome_181.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_181.text: Damned nutter. You - you think I fear death?
HiddenGnome_181.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

HiddenGnome_88.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_88.text: Now you're getting it. I'd sooner walk the Hells than be tortured at Moonrise!

HiddenGnome_64.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_64.text: Gaerdal Ironhand, I have lived for you, and now I'll die for you!

HiddenGnome_198.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_198.text: I know what you're doing. And it ends, here and now.

HiddenGnome_111.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_111.text: I don't care. Go on, blow us up.

HiddenGnome_157.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_157.context: NodeContext: Creepy sounding. She is taking pleasure in her murder-suicide.

HiddenGnome_204.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_204.text: You wouldn't dare - you don't have the courage.

HiddenGnome_199.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_199.context: CinematicNodeContext: Philomeen gestures and the flame in her hand briefly sparks even more.

HiddenGnome_78.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_78.text: Holy hells. Have you gone mad?

HiddenGnome_8.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_8.text: Damn right, pecker. Now shut your face before I melt it clean off.

HiddenGnome_93.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_93.text: I know what you are - one of Nere's cult-goons. Sailed right in.

HiddenGnome_167.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_167.text: Look at me - I'm not here to hurt my own.

HiddenGnome_124.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_124.text: I'll do worse to Nere's lapdog, hoon.

HiddenGnome_110.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_110.text: Smokepowder's no toy. Whatever happens to me, it will be far worse for you.

HiddenGnome_125.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_125.text: Do it. I could do with a show.

HiddenGnome_85.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_85.text: I'm not here to hurt you. You have my word.

HiddenGnome_180.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_180.text: Raise your hands in a show of peace.

HiddenGnome_83.speaker: Player
HiddenGnome_83.text: Don't be dumb. Check your exits - you've got nowhere to go.

HiddenGnome_202.speaker: Astarion
HiddenGnome_202.text: Easy now, let's not do anything hilarious.
HiddenGnome_202.context: NodeContext: Gnome is threatening to blow herself up, but Astarion is pretty sure he'll survive the blast

HiddenGnome_72.speaker: Wyll
HiddenGnome_72.text: Hells. Whatever you do, don't set her off.

HiddenGnome_135.speaker: Gale
HiddenGnome_135.text: As an expert on the subject, my dear lady - I'd like to point out that blowing oneself up is never the solution.
HiddenGnome_135.context: NodeContext: He's addressing the gnome, not the player.

HiddenGnome_210.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome_210.text: Get moving. I'll be doing the same.

PAD_0.speaker: Player
PAD_0.text: He hid from the Hells' forces - but they still got to him.
